method.name: Naive Bayes Classifier

reference.ref: P. Domingos and M. Pazzani. On the optimality of the simple Bayesian classifier under zero-one loss. Machine Learning, 29 (1997) 103?137.
M.E. Maron. Automatic Indexing: An Experimental Inquiry. Journal of the ACM (JACM) 8:3 (1961) 404?417.

generalDescription.objective: A naive Bayes classifier is a simple probabilistic classifier based on applying Bayes' theorem with strong (naive) independence assumptions. A more descriptive term for the underlying probability model would be independent feature model.
generalDescription.howWork: We compute the conditional probability of every example to be on each class. Then the output class of the example will be assigned as the highest conditional probability calculated.
